qas.question: How can bacteria obtain raw materials from the environment?

answers.text: in the form of relatively small molecules

qas.question: What chemical process  helps bacteria to absorb raw materials?
What process is used by eukaryotic cells to absorb external items?
What part of bacteria cell is used during diffusion?

context: Regardless of the type of metabolic process they employ, the majority of bacteria are able to take in raw materials only <a0_0>in the form of relatively small molecules<a0_0/>, which enter the cell by <a1_0>diffusion<a1_0/> or through <a3_0>molecular channels in cell membranes<a3_0/>. The Planctomycetes are the exception (as they are in possessing membranes around their nuclear material). It has recently been shown that Gemmata obscuriglobus is able to take in large molecules via a process that in some ways resembles <a2_0>endocytosis<a2_0/>, the process used by eukaryotic cells to engulf external items.
